headline.main: AID TO BRITAIN SEEN AS BLOCKING WAR; 70% Believe Such Help Is a Big Factor in Keeping Us Out, Gallup Survey Finds 85% OPPOSE OUR ENTRY Sending Material to England Is Regarded by Most Voters as Checking the Nazis

lead_paragraph: Seventy per cent of those questioned by the American Institute of Public Opinion believe that aid to Britain contributes to keeping the United States out of war, according to a report made yesterday by Dr. George Gallup, director of the organization.
abstract: Gallup polls show war entry opposed by 85% of voters and aid to Brit seen as war bar by 70%
